Name: Philosophers Stone
Description: Gazing into its crimson depths you can see the concentrated life essence of countless victims swirling inside of it. The artifact was completed in the moment of the creators' death, as his soul was claimed by his creation. Now residing among the souls of his former victims, his essence as an alchemist provides the stone with ultimate transmutative powers.

Name: high boots
Description: A pair of sturdy leather boots which extend upward until just below the knee.

Name: low boots
Description: A pair of sturdy leather boots which extend upwards to just above the ankle.

Name: Talaria
Description: Winged sandals made of imperishable gold which fly the wearer swiftly and silently.

Name: leather cloak
Description: An article of leather clothing covering the torso that hangs around the neck and on the shoulders.

Name: oilskin cloak
Description: An article of waterproof cotton clothing covering the torso that hangs around the neck and on the shoulders.

Name: leather gloves
Description: Sturdy leather garments fitted firm onto the hands, sheathing each finger individually.

Name: fedora
Description: A soft-brimmed hat, somewhat out of fashion.

Name: helmet
Description: Standard issue protective metal headgear.

Name: small shield
Description: A lightweight protective panel strapped to the forearm, made from wood with metal reinforcement.

Name: hawaiian shirt
Description: Bold, or just tacky?

Name: battle robe
Description: A long, flowing garment, with long sleeves and a hood.

Name: chain mail
Description: Chain mail consists of a mesh of metal rings interlinked to form a flexible armour.

Name: elemental robe
Description: A long, flowing garment, with long sleeves and a hood.

Name: fleet robe
Description: A long, flowing garment, with long sleeves and a hood.

Name: hermit robe
Description: A long, flowing garment, with long sleeves and a hood.

Name: leather armour
Description: Boiled leather, moulded into a bodily shape to be donned as light armour.

Name: leather jacket
Description: A thick leather coat, constructed to withstand weather and wear.

Name: ring mail
Description: A suit of armour made from metal rings sewn onto a foundation of leather or cloth.

Name: robe
Description: A long, flowing garment, with long sleeves and a hood.

Name: splint mail
Description: A heavy suit of armour made up of many strips of metal.

Name: studded leather armour
Description: Leather armour with close-set studs so as to offer more protection.

Name: apple
Description: A sweet, round fruit, of the red variety. Reportedly a great supplement to your physical health.

Name: banana
Description: A curved yellow fruit, and a great source of fibre.

Name: carrot
Description: An orange root-vegetable, commonly believed to improve eyesight.

Name: clove of garlic
Description: One segment of a particularly pungent and bulbous herb.

Name: cream pie
Description: A sweet custard-filled pie with a thin crust, topped with whipped cream.

Name: fish
Description: A slimy, scaly sea creature, in its entirety. Good for a meal.

Name: food ration
Description: A hearty, multi-portioned and nutritious vegetarian meal.

Name: fortune cookie
Description: An inconspicuous snack that tells deep secrets.

Name: holy wafer
Description: A sanctimonious biscuit. A miracle to the meek, a scourge to the undead.

Name: iron ration
Description: A package of preserved meats, all dried and chewy.

Name: lembas wafer
Description: An elven travel food. It is incredibly satiating.

Name: meat stick
Description: A stick of cured meat.

Name: orange
Description: A sweet citrus fruit, coloured eponymously.

Name: pancake
Description: A flat, round cake. Cooked in a pan, as you might presume.

Name: slime mould
Description: An ambiguous curiosity. It seems edible.

Name: sprig of wolfsbane
Description: The snipped segment of a plant known for its antilycanthropic properties.

Name: tripe ration
Description: A meal made from the stomach lining of an animal.

Name: gold coin
Description: The only coin that can be found and spent in the dungeon.

Name: amber
Description: This gemstone is made from hardened tree sap.

Name: flint
Description: A hard rock, smooth and therefore aerodynamic.

Name: rock
Description: A sturdy and solid mineral.

Name: potion of gain energy
Description: This is a potion of pure magical energy which will restore and increase your mana.

Name: potion of ink
Description: This convenient vial of ink can be used to replenish your markers.

Name: potion of oil
Description: This handy canister of oil can be used to refuel your lamps and lanterns.

Name: ring of berserking
Description: The wearer will occasionally fly into uncontrollable rage lashing out at both friend and foe.

Name: ring of impact
Description: This ring augments the damage caused by your strikes

Name: scroll of charging
Description: This utility scroll restores some of the charges to your spent wands and tools.

Name: scroll of replication
Description: This powerful magic can be used to create copies of any item.

Name: scroll of summoning
Appearance: scroll labelled LEP GEX VEN ZEA

Name: porter
Description: A spacious bag made of incredibly stretchy cotton.

Name: sack
Description: A spacious cloth bag.

Name: caltrops
Description: Tiny metal spikes thrown to the ground to impede mobility.

Name: blindfold
Description: A cloth mask that completely obstructs the wearer's vision.

Name: brass bugle
Description: A hand-held brass horn.

Name: oil lamp
Description: A portable source of light fashioned out of copper and fuelled by oil.

Name: Prudentia
Description: This glowing looking glass reveals glimpses of the future and corrupts your soul.

Name: lock pick
Description: A small iron tool designed for opening all sorts of locks.

Name: pick-axe
Description: A pointed iron bar fashioned at a right-angle to a sturdy wooden handle, used to pierce through hard surfaces.

Name: skeleton key
Description: A key designed to open all mundane locks.

Name: expensive camera
Description: A foreign device which creates perfect visual depictions of reality.

Name: magic marker
Description: This magical pen has only a limited amount of ink. It seems to vibrate and move on its own accord when you hold it in your hand. You wonder what it would do if you pressed it to some paper.

Name: tinning kit
Description: A collection of utensils, including empty tins and butchering tools, for packing corpses so as to condense them.

Name: wand of digging
Description: Zapping it at a wall creates a big tunnel.

Name: Witherloch
Description: This withered hand is the last remnant of an ancient and powerful lich.

Name: Ancient Katana
Description: This old katana has been battered and broken through a million battles. Hardly more than a scrap of metal and wood and yet it flickers with a strange power.

Name: axe
Description: A sharp iron wedge fashioned to a sturdy handle.

Name: battle-axe
Description: This axe is specifically designed to facilitate deep, grievous wounds in combat. This large weapon is wielded in both hands.

Name: club
Description: A thick wooden bludgeon. What it lacks in style, it makes up for in function.

Name: Colossal Excavator
Description: This ancient artifact is a marvel to behold with exquisite craftsmanship and unbridled digging power.

Name: Dragonbane
Description: Forged deep underground by dwarven hands, this blade was made to slay the scaled beasts who sought to steal their treasures. Throughout the long years this blade has bathed in the blood of its winged prey. Now almost forgotten, it yearns again for the taste of dragon flesh.

Name: dwarvish mattock
Description: This tool is used for digging and chopping, similar to the pick-axe. It has a long handle, and a stout head, which combines an axe blade and an adze. It can also be used as an effective melee weapon.

Name: dwarvish short sword
Description: This dwarvish manufactured sword is sturdy and suited to being wielded in the offhand.

Name: elven short sword
Description: This light blade of elvish manufacture is particularly suited as an offhand weapon.

Name: katana
Description: This is a sharp and curved single-edged blade with a circular guard and long grip.

Name: knife
Description: A small cutting utensil made of metal with a wooden handle.

Name: long sword
Description: A straight, double-edged, and often cruciform blade.

Name: mace
Description: A sophisticated bludgeon with a heavy iron head.

Name: Masamune
Description: A righteous sword forged by a revered blacksmith many years ago who set out to hone his craft and to create the ultimate blade. The noble intent of its creator lingers in this weapon to cut down the wicked and protect the innocent.

Name: morning star
Description: A mace that is spiked on its head.

Name: Muramasa
Description: The final sword forged by a once respected blacksmith who lost himself in the depths of the dungeon. His warped soul now inhabits this blade and lusts for blood. It is said that the one who wields this sword is coerced into cutting down friend and foe alike.

Name: quarterstaff
Description: A hardwood pole. It is an unassuming but formidable weapon in trained hands.

Name: rapier
Description: A thin and agile sword meant almost exclusively for thrusting.

Name: sabre
Description: A curved single-edged blade often used by cavalry.

Name: scalpel
Description: An extremely sharp little blade used for precise incisions.

Name: scimitar
Description: This is a sword weapon with a long curved design.

Name: short sword
Description: A short and light double-edged blade.

Name: silver sabre
Description: A curved single-edged blade often used by cavalry, especially effective against creatures of the netherworld.

Name: Sunsword
Description: This powerful artifact blade glows with a holy fury that lights the area.

Name: two-handed sword
Description: A heavy and long double-edged blade. Similar to a long sword, scaled-up specifically for two-handed usage.

Name: Verimurus
Description: A surviving portion of the legendary wall of Verimurus, an ancient elven city said to have lasted since time immemorial. However, not even the mightiest walls could withstand the endless onslaught of the dragons. Now the enchanted walls stand alone over the land that once held them.

Name: wakizashi
Description: Like a smaller variant of the katana, often used as a side-arm.

Name: war hammer
Description: A heavy iron hammer designed specifically for use in melee combat.

Name: arrow
Description: A projectile consisting of a wooden shaft with a sharp metal tip at its front and stabilising fins at its rear.

Name: bullet
Description: A pointed metal cylinder meant to be discharged from a firearm.

Name: crossbow bolt
Description: An iron projectile made up of a shaft with a sharpened square-pyramid tip.

Name: ya
Description: A long-shafted arrow with a distinctive tip.

Name: blowgun
Description: A long pipe meant for shooting darts through force of breath.

Name: bow
Description: A semi-rigid weapon made up of a notched wooden shaft with a drawstring attached to both ends, used to launch arrows.

Name: crossbow
Description: A horizontal, mechanically-aided bow and arrow with a shoulder stock.

Name: pistol
Description: A compact hand-held firearm.

Name: shotgun
Description: A two-handed firearm, steadied at the shoulder, often used in small game hunting. It packs quite a punch.

Name: sling
Description: A leather pouch set between two cords, meant for launching small projectiles.

Name: yumi
Description: A tall, asymmetric bow.

Name: bardiche
Description: This is a pole weapon with a long, cleaver type blade.

Name: bec de corbin
Description: This is a pole weapon consisting of a modified hammer head and spike mounted atop a long pole.

Name: bill-guisarme
Description: This weapon consists of a hooked chopping blade with several pointed projections mounted on a staff. The end of the cutting blade curves forward to form a hook. In addition, the blade has one pronounced spike straight off the top like a spear head, and also a hook or spike mounted on the reverse side of the blade.

Name: bullwhip
Description: A long, flexible leather thong. Unexpectedly sharp.

Name: Drilanze
Description: A wonder of dwarven ingenuity and craftsmanship, stolen and repurposed by orcs. Mounted on a long shaft, this tool is a formidable weapon on horseback or warg-back. The electrical current that powers its drill will occasionally discharge on whomever is willing to stand in the way of this monstrosity.

Name: dwarvish spear
Description: This compact, dwarvish manufactured spear is ideal for close quarters combat.

Name: elven spear
Description: Its high-quality elvish manufacture makes for an effective close combat weapon.

Name: fauchard
Description: This is a curved blade put atop a long pole. The blade is moderately curved along its length with the cutting edge only on the concave side.

Name: glaive
Description: This weapon consists of a large blade on the end of a long pole. The blade is affixed in a socket-shaft configuration similar to an axe head.

Name: guisarme
Description: This weapon consists of a single-edged blade on the end of a pole.

Name: halberd
Description: This is a two-handed pole weapon consisting of an axe blade with a spike mounted on a long shaft.

Name: lance
Description: A long thrusting polearm best suited to mounted combat.

Name: Lashing Tongue
Description: This curious artifact somehow chastens those it strikes and submits them to your will.

Name: lucern hammer
Description: This hammer is a four-pronged head mounted atop a long polearm stick. It bears a long spike on its reverse and an even longer spike extending from the very top. It proves effective at puncturing or smashing armour as well as dismounting riders.

Name: partisan
Description: This weapon consists of a spearhead mounted on a long wooden shaft with protrusions on the sides which aided in parrying sword thrusts.

Name: ranseur
Description: The head of a ranseur consists of a spear-tip affixed with a cross hilt at its base.

Name: scythe
Description: Agricultural implement consisting of a long curving blade and fastened to an angled handle.

Name: spetum
Description: This weapon consists of a long pole with a mounted a spear head and two projections at its base.

Name: voulge
Description: This weapon is a curved blade attached to a pole by binding the lower two-thirds of the blade to the side of the pole, to form a sort of axe.

Name: boomerang
Description: A flat throwing weapon made of wood, often used for hunting.

Name: dagger
Description: A long iron knife with a sharp tip, weighted for throwing.

Name: dart
Description: A small missile with a pointed tip meant for throwing.

Name: elven dagger
Description: This high-quality elven manufactured dagger is perfectly weighted for throwing.

Name: javelin
Description: This is a light spear designed to be thrown by hand.

Name: orcish dagger
Description: This crudely made blade is still an effective throwing weapon.

Name: poison dart
Description: A small missile with a reservoir of liquid delivered through a hollow pointed tip.

Name: shuriken
Description: A sharp metal throwing weapon, smaller than a hand and shaped like a star.

Name: stick of dynamite
Description: A stick of highly explosive material, with a short fuse on one end.
